intro: Beaufortia velutina, commonly known as the silky beaufortia, is a flowering plant native to western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a soft, silky appearance. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Beaufortia velutina is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native region.
